As the in game craft description says. Hit caps for soft controls and this should be very similar to the XP-55 in warthunder. Which, I fly exclusively. The only other things you might want to do for realism is keep the throttle down so it can never get past it's max stats for a propeller.

Also, use SAS for stability.

Real stats: (translated to KSP numbers. If I'm not mistaken.)

Max speed: 174.444 m/s (5,882m)

Max altitude: 10,500m

Length: 9.0m

Width: 12.4m

Height: 3.0m

I have no idea if the other stats are correct like rate of climb, or the power ratio, etc. But It feels like the one in warthunder a bit if you use the fine controls.

The wings look a little funny also. But there isn't a part small enough to fit this plane in stock.

Without SAS the nose falls down for some reason. With it it flies perfectly smooth.

I wish I could really dig into the craft file and tinker with it. As it stands, I can't do a lot of troubleshooting for you

My instinct with the nose-down problem is in your center of lift. It seems to be at a crazy angle relative to the craft, and I'm guessing that's because you have so many rotated/translated control surfaces. The game gets confused when you do that too much. Turn a control surface even a tiny amount and it will jump way out of position. That can be exploited, but here it looks like it's working against you. My advice is to do a top-down rebuilt, but take a different approach to your control surfaces.
